title: Compiler panicked when installing `mdbook-mermaid=0.12.6`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
(Need some time to reproduce on nightly) This looks kinda similar to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/111542 from a couple hours ago. ### Reproducing On WSL, I ran: ```bash cargo install mdbook # Installed mdbook v0.4.29 cargo install mdbook-mermaid # Panicked ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0 (84c898d65 2023-04-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc commit-date: 2023-04-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0 LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... error: failed to compile `mdbook-mermaid v0.12.6`, intermediate artifacts can be found at `/tmp/cargo-install57aL4h` ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'could not lift for printing', compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/print/pretty.rs:2664:1 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f5de1c0131a -
